physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal vital signs and oxygen saturation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Firm, pink papule (4 mm in diameter) on the left posterior shoulder; flesh-colored papule (2 to 3 mm in diameter) on the left anterior shoulder; numerous atrophic scars and cysts on the trunk and thighs; healing biopsy sites on the back; healing linear incision with intact sutures on the central chest; no palpable peripheral lymphadenopathy; remainder of the examination was normal.
Inguinal lymph nodes decreased in size; largest node was now 2.0 cm by 0.6 cm, no longer showed increased FDG avidity; skin thickening in the left lateral thigh with increased FDG avidity.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The size of the inguinal lymph nodes decreased from 4.1 cm by 2.4 cm to 2.0 cm by 0.6 cm, indicating improvement.
